results.title: Carnivore capers
results.creator_credit: Mark Laughlin, Tony Paice and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: This program set in the Royal Melbourne Zoo looks at three types of carnivores - lions, cape hunting dogs and seals, and follows the keeper through a typical day.

results.title: Rainbows on the wing
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Ian Toohill and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: One of a series that looks at departments of the Royal Melbourne Zoo. This program takes a look at the work of the keeper in charge of the Butterfly Enclosure.

results.title: Let's not say goodbye
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: The destruction of Australia’s bushland and forests threatens already endangered species. Members of the Theatre in Education and the Real Fantasy Theatre Company take a humorous look at this serious problem.

results.title: Zoo creatures great and small
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Rob McCubbin and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Andrew Tribe, zoo veterinarian, and Jeanne de Lacy, zoo keeper, both from Royal Melbourne Zoological Gardens, Zoo Education Service Staff, are interviewed by Trevor Lunn. Animals come to the zoo, often after car accidents and are examined and treated in the veterinary department or nursery. Training for zoo keepers and zoo veterinarians is discussed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, Rob McCubbin and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Greek curriculum
results.creator_credit: Dimitri Man and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: The Greek Curriculum program is designed for children in Australian schools catering for the mother tongue and second language learners. The same program is repeated twice. The first has English subtitles and Greek dialogue whilst the second is in Greek only.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dimitri Man and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: What is a firefighter?
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Trevor Lunn introduces Brion Jones, Station Officer, M.F.B. who outlines the training and different tasks performed by fireman including rescuing people from fires, extinguishing fires, preventing the spread and property damage caused by fires, road rescue, assisting with chemical incidents, gas leaks and unusual rescues from cliffs, trenches and drains.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch

results.title: Why can't hippos climb trees?
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Rob McCubbin and Education Department of Victoria for Zoo Education Services
results.brief_description: Gaye Hamilton, a zoo education officer and Year 11 students from Braybrook High School examine the different structures of animals that enable them to survive. Using video inserts and live animals in the studio they discover the adaptations of animals that enable them to live in trees, in water or on the ground.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, Rob McCubbin and Education Department of Victoria for Zoo Education Services

results.title: Show me English: enrolling in class [episode 8]
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: A series of programmes which aim to help adult migrants communicate in everyday situations. Tina decides to enrol in English classes following a successful association with Sue, her home tutor. Home tutor program by the Adult Migrant Information Service.

results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Victoria. Ministry of Education

results.title: Show me English: the local council [episode 6]
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: A series of programmes which aim to help adult migrants communicate in everyday situations. A problem tree growing outside Tina’s home necessitates the involvement of the local council in reaching a satisfactory solution. Home tutor program by the Adult Migrant Information Service.
